class.name: EPASOneshotAnimationNode
class.brief_description: Animation node that doesn't support looping, but allows for fancy motion warping and root motion magic.

method.name: get_root_motion_transform
method.description: Returns the offset that should be applied to [member root_motion_starting_transform] to make the [Skeleton3D] match the root motion.

method.name: is_playing
method.description: Returns [code]true[/code] if the animation is currently being played.

method.name: play
method.description: Starts playback of the animation from 0.

method.name: play_with_warp_points
method.description: Utility function that allows starting playback while setting all warp points at once and checks that you have all of them. You should pass this a [Dictionary] with a StringName key for each warp point, with the values being the [Transform3D] of each warp point. This will also set your root motion starting transform to whatever the [Skeleton3D]'s global transform is. [b]Note:[/b] don't forget to set your [member root_motion_forward]!

method.name: set_warp_point_transform
method.description: Sets the transform of a given warp point.

members.member: The root bone that is used for root motion.
The forward vector of the animation, this is used for cases where the forward of the authored model doesn't match godot's -Z forward, such as when using blender models.
The starting transform of the [Skeleton3D] at the time the animation was started.
If [code]true[/code] makes the animation use root motion.

signal.name: playback_finished
signal.description: Emitted when the animation has finished playing.
